DOC.brief_summary: Previous analyses of the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey have suggested that the mortality rate associated with obesity has decreased over calendar time in the U.S. population, potentially due to improvements in the medical care of obesity and its associated diseases. The primary aim of this project is to evaluate whether this reduction in the detrimental association of obesity with mortality rate over calendar time is supported by other data from U.S. prospective studies.
DOC.criteria: U.S. based studies with at least 1500 subjects At least 5 years of mortality followup BMI measured or selfreported available at 2 or more separate calendar time Subjects varied in age at baseline Any study that does not meet the inclusion criteria was excluded
